content: अष्टक {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [अष्ट परिमाणमस्य कन्] Consisting of {8} parts, eight-fold; क्रोधजोऽपि गणोऽष्टकः <ls>Ms. 7. 48.</ls> --कः {@--1@} [अष्टकं (पाणिनेः), विदंति अधीयते वा इत्यष्टकाः <ls>P. IV. 2. 65</ls> <ls>Sk.</ls>] One who studies or is acquainted with the eight books of Pāṇini's grammar. {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of a son of Viśvāmitra. --का [ अश्नंति पितरोऽस्यां तिथौ अश्-तकन् <ls>Uṇ. 3. 148</ls>] {@--1@} A collection of three days (7th, 8th, and 9th) beginning from the seventh day after the full moon. {@--2@} The 8th day of three months on which the Manes are to be propitiated. {@--3@} A Śrāddha to be performed on the above days; worship of the Manes on certain days. {@--4@} The 8th day of a month; <ls>Ms. 4. 113-4</ls>. --कं {@--1@} A whole consisting of {8} parts. {@--2@} The {8} chapters of Pāṇini's sūtras; अष्टावध्यायाः परिमाणमस्य इत्यष्टकं; पाणिनेः सूत्रं <ls>Sk.</ls>. {@--3@} The study of the Sūtras. {@--4@} A division of the Ṛgveda (it being divided into 8 Aṣṭakas or 10 Maṇḍalas). {@--5@} Any group of eight; as वानराष्टकं, ताराष्टकं, गंगाष्टकं &c. {@--6@} The number eight.
